spans.text: This is the first time Taki has visited Anon's apartment.
Of course, that's not to say they're not on good terms...
After all, most of their previous gatherings had been arranged at Soyo's much larger house.
Anon, completely oblivious to what Taki was thinking, had been visibly excited ever since they were a hundred meters away from her home.
Until now—
(Don't be nervous, you and her are actually doing pretty well – compared to some people.)
Heh heh – are you ready! To enter the world of the great streamer, Anon Chihaya—!!!
Okay, okay, hurry up and open the door, don't waste time.
Anon took out her card and lightly swiped it in front of the electronic lock.
Rikki really doesn't know how to play along...
Who told you to be so flamboyant all the time.
Say something nice to people once in a while...
Chattering like this, Taki followed Anon into her apartment, which she had never visited before.
After putting on the disposable slippers Anon handed her, Taki followed her host's footsteps, looking around at the interior as she walked in.
It was a very simple decoration, so simple that it didn't fit the image of Anon Chihaya at all.
Taki was a little surprised.
Fortunately, this feeling was as short as the depth of the apartment.
They reached the end in just a few steps, and Anon held the doorknob with one hand and beckoned to Taki with the other, mysteriously.
Heh heh – this time it's for real – Rikki, are you ready?
In the end, it's just a look at your studio, what is there to prepare for?
Anon Chihaya gave a rather smug smile and wagged her index finger.
The next second, the doorknob turned.
The mysterious space was finally revealed to Taki Shiina.
Welcome to – the world of Anon Tokyo—!!!!!
Anon spread her arms and stood firmly in the doorway.
It took Taki a long time to realize what was going on.
I mean, is it really necessary? Do I really have to say those words... Can I go back now?
The pink-haired girl's ability to change emotions was no exaggeration, and instantly, two teardrops gathered in the corners of her eyes, looking pitiful.
I'm so done – alright, alright, alright—!!
Taki stiffly cupped her face.
Oh my god – I'm so honored – to be able to see the studio of the famous streamer, Anon Tokyo—
(Are you satisfied now???)
The words were monotonous and devoid of inflection, and the perfunctoriness was obvious. After compromising, Taki's eyes also issued a silent threat towards the pink hair.
However, Anon was not afraid at all.
Perhaps she had gradually tested the limits of Taki's unexpectedly flexible bottom line today during their previous encounters, or perhaps she was simply certain of this person's soft heart.
Hehe, I knew Rikki was the best – please come in! Welcome, Miss Shiina!
Taki Shiina was finally able to see the full picture of the small studio.

It was small but complete. Lights, microphones, mirrors... everything was fully equipped. The closet, desk, lights, and even the clutter on the sofa had been carefully arranged – of course, all of this could not escape Anon's mysterious taste in decoration.
Taki suddenly felt relieved.
(As expected, this is how it should be. This is Anon's style.)
This is Rikki's first time here! In that case, let me, Anon, personally give you a good tour!
Anon was indeed not being polite.

She was very patient in introducing the layout of the room to Taki one by one, as if she were listing her family's treasures, and from time to time she would hold up an item and explain its function or special meaning in detail.
Like now.
Rikki—Rikki~~~! Look at this!
This is…
It was a poster that Taki knew all too well, the same as the one she treasured at home.
The color-printed paper was slightly yellowed, indicating that it was old, and it had been framed by the owner and hung on the background wall facing the live camera.
And the clear and transparent mirror surface shone with a brilliance that was in no way inferior to the various metal medals around it under the light.
It was right in the center.
Taki forgot to speak for a moment.
Don't tell me you've forgotten – this is the poster and ticket stub from our first MyGO concert!
No, I just didn't expect you...
It's so important – it was the first time everyone designed something together! Of course I'm protecting it well!
There are many things you didn't expect... Who told Rikki not to come and see me usually!
Taki Shiina was irrefutable.
You're probably right.
Taki suddenly realized that this seemed to be the first time in all these years that she had truly understood Anon's work and life.
(Perhaps it's because I'm just that kind of person...)
Taki looked up at Anon, who was still excitedly introducing the live streaming equipment and fan gifts to her.
...And this and this! I really like them – I even wrote back to them specifically...
The girl, when talking about these things, was filled with a soft light, and these small, scattered lights were all reflected in Taki's pupils without exception.
(It's really... annoying.)
Okay.
She gently interrupted Anon's unfinished words.
I know what a stupid question I asked – you really love this job, and you really love your audience.
(Yes, I should have known.)
(No one can always do something with the greatest enthusiasm and perseverance.)
(Unless her efforts receive the rewards they deserve.)
(Regardless of whether that reward is money, power, fame, or... love.)
Your audience loves you too.
You've accepted this love, haven't you?
Taki's words were sincere.
Anon's face gradually became serious.
Anon vaguely felt a little flustered.
That feeling of a sudden missed heartbeat made her involuntarily grab the other person's sleeve and call out the name that she rarely called.
Taki.
It's okay, I'm fine.
I'm just feeling sentimental.
Yes.
Taki Shiina had just discovered yet another of her base weaknesses.
Yes. Maybe that's how it is...
Actually, you saw this point earlier than I did, didn't you, Anon?
Anon didn't answer.
She just stared blankly at Taki.
I've always... seemed to be running away, always, um... deliberately ignoring what I've gained, and just getting caught up in my own emotions.
As a result, I don't seem to have ever given anything back to everyone...
Because I'm like this...
So even if one day, the part of me that is a person is abandoned by this world, it wouldn't be surprising,
Right?
Taki—!
A sufficiently sharp cry.
From Anon, who was usually known for her good temper.
How can you say such a thing! You... you... you...
In short, you can't say such a thing!!!
Unlike Anon's panicked impatience, Taki was unexpectedly good-tempered.
Rather, Anon finally realized that ever since they met at RiNG today, the other person's temper had been abnormally good.

Taki, what's wrong with you? Are you having any difficulties? Are you sick? Or has something happened at home? Is there anything I can help you with? What do you need? Money? I can give you money, Taki, I'm the world's number one Anon Tokyo!
My channel still makes a lot of money, and I've been saving it all along. I originally wanted to hold a top-notch live concert for our MyGO, and I can transfer it to you right away if you need it—
Taki pressed down on Anon's hand, which had suddenly clenched her sleeve.
She didn't know what to say for a moment, pursed her lips and thought for a long time, and finally could only squeeze out a smile.
(Uh…)
(She's definitely hiding something from me.)
(Otherwise she wouldn't be smiling like that – it's even uglier than crying.)
But Anon didn't have the guts to say these words after all.
Okay.
I'm really fine.
It's just that I haven't had any inspiration for writing songs lately, and I have too many rejected drafts, so I'm feeling a little depressed.
Really?
Really.
Really, really, really, really?
Really, really, really, really... Do I seem like someone who would lie to you about this kind of thing?
Hard to say.
Hey—
Fortunately, the vibration reminder from her phone saved Taki.
The bickering stopped, and Taki looked down to see the message she had received.
(Subscription notification... Thank goodness – I put my phone on vibrate before coming in so I wouldn't disturb her recording.)
Taki's face was very wrong.
This was what Anon noticed immediately.
What, what, what did you receive – could it be a debt collection message? Let me—
Wait.
Reaching out to push away Anon's face that was getting closer, Taki quickly swiped away the message box and showed the other person the phone's home page, which only had the time interface.
I remember... you said you were going to start your live stream at what time?
Anon was scrambling to prepare the equipment for the live stream.

Taki quietly breathed a sigh of relief, stood aside and watched for a while, and seeing that Anon was completely absorbed in her work and had no time to care about the previous topic, she immediately decided to strike while the iron was hot and say goodbye to the streamer.
(She shouldn't be in the mood to listen to what I'm saying right now, so I'll just say hello and leave.)
(If I stay any longer, I don't know if my one-in-a-million bad luck will have an impact on the live stream...)
What? No—you can't!
Rikki~~~~~~
Contrary to what Taki thought, when she heard that she was going to say goodbye, Anon immediately crossed over from the scattered items and directly hugged Taki's lower back as she turned to leave.
What followed was a coquettish act with eighteen turns at the end of her voice, heading straight for the Akina mountain road.
Even though she was wearing enough clothes, Taki Shiina still shivered.
Stay, stay!

You've already stayed for so long, it's not like you're missing out on the live stream – and didn't we agree at the beginning that you would come to my live stream together – you haven't even seen my channel!
You just said you wouldn't lie to me!
Unexpected persistence.
Expected unreasonable behavior.
Is that what I meant just now??!!
And who said I haven't seen your channel!
You've seen it? You've seen it?! You've actually seen it?! I even snatched your phone and clicked on the follow myself – tell me, what did you see!
It's that one, the series that made you an overnight sensation.
Uh... what was it called...

"Anon London", I remember, "Anon London", your return to London series – the day I clicked in, I saw you puking by the Thames – I've been watching every live stream and clip since then, until you limped back with a crutch.
I even gave you a few superchats!
This is indeed the most famous and popular video series on the Anon Tokyo channel.

It was also the most critical node for Anon to transform from an unknown small game streamer to a life-sharing streamer and become a mid-level streamer, and was once evaluated by netizens as "the god of variety shows descending to do live streaming".
—Because the streamer was having bad luck almost every minute.
If you still don't believe me, I can keep going.

You ran into a rainstorm and your flight was delayed for six hours on your first day, and you were taken into a small black room by customs after getting off the plane because your makeup was too heavy and your passport didn't look the same. After finally getting out, you said the wrong address when taking a taxi and had to walk six kilometers more to get to the hotel. You were so overwhelmed by the sweetness when you went to a store that you drank three cups of water in a row...
Enough, really enough.
Can you please not remind me, I've already sworn that I'll never set foot on the British Isles again in my life.
But didn't you also happily start a 【Anon xxx】 travel series?
To be honest, it's not as good as London – why don't you immigrate to England, I feel like you could make a lot of money.
You might not believe it, but I was originally planning to announce my retirement from the influencer world after that one gig.
Ah, don't change the subject – I don't care!! I want you to broadcast with me!!!!!!

Besides, none of the MyGO members have been on my channel for a long time! The last time was when Tomori came during Golden Week – I don't want people to only remember me as the influencer streamer Anon and not remember my proud identity as the MyGO guitarist~~~~~
You have the nerve to mention this – have you forgotten how many messed up comments Tomori saw back then!
That was indeed my fault... but I had the moderators deal with it at the time – and Tomorin is Tomorin, Rikki is Rikki!
Rikki just needs to not let my live stream get banned like your flame account! After all, Rikki has many accounts, but I only have this one live stream channel!
Anon seemed to have said something terrible.
Even Anon herself only realized it after she had finished speaking and covered her mouth.
In the not-so-spacious room, the already not-so-smooth airflow seemed to freeze at this moment and hit the ground heavily.
Taki's face suddenly turned red, and she turned her face away to the side.
In fact, Taki was not as angry as Anon thought she would be.
Perhaps she was originally going to shout something.
But when she saw the face in the makeup mirror beside her, all the irritability that had arisen from having her secret exposed suddenly disappeared.
(This person... is this person in the mirror me?)
Taki saw a face that she didn't know how to describe, a gaunt, haggard, and gloomy face.
Even if the blush on her face had not completely faded, this was definitely not a face that could be described with positive words such as moist and healthy.
Rather, the thin redness caused by emotional fluctuations only served to highlight the person's unhealthiness.
I... I should go first.
Anon followed Taki's gaze to the makeup mirror with sharp eyes – she immediately realized the reason for the other person's change in mood.
Without saying a word, Anon pulled Taki and sat her down in front of the makeup mirror.
Okay! So you're not wearing makeup!
Why don't I, the invincible Anon, help you put it on – I have a lot of good stuff that brands have sent me here!
Hey! Don't move!
Don't look at me like that! I know you guys doubt my taste – but honestly! My makeup skills are still pretty good, right! Otherwise, how would I get so many makeup ads!
Who knows if the brands want to be quirky—Ouch, okay, I won't say it anymore, stop it!
Rikki, your face is now in my hands.
If you say one more word, I'll really turn you into a monkey!
That being said, Anon carefully put on makeup for Taki.
(She clearly has such a beautiful face...)
(I really don't know what you're afraid of...)
Unlocked CG: Stream of Love
Speaking of which, Tomori and Soyo mentioned that the first time they met Rikki, you were wearing makeup...
You guys were talking about this behind my back—Hiss, be gentle, please, my eyelashes are also very precious.

I told you, your face is now in my hands... Sigh, it's really annoying, no matter how you look at it, your features are so exquisite, if it weren't for the fact that the live stream lighting might be affected and the contrast would be too abrupt, I would have wanted you to go on camera without makeup...
That's absolutely not okay – so what else did Tomori and Soyo say?
Of course they praised you for being good-looking – a particularly handsome face, paired with an equally handsome name, plus skillful technique and a thoughtful attitude.
Fortunately, you have a terrible temper – this is what Soyo said, God is still relatively fair, otherwise I really don't know how many people would love you to death.
Love to death is okay, but death is out of the question.
Hey, it's just a figure of speech! Why are you so superstitious! So old-fashioned... Thinking about it this way, Rikki, didn't you start wearing makeup in middle school?
I was in the brass band for a while...
Ah, that's right. You guys also need to wear makeup for performances... No wonder... Where did Rikki learn it from? A teacher? Or magazines and online tutorials?
Um…
…It was my sister.
